communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI: Steve Ross
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of FBI files on Steve Ross, former CEO of Warner Communications, whose death was widely reported in the media on Dec. 21, 1992 (https://www.nytimes.com/1992/12/21/obituaries/the-creator-of-time-warner-steven-j-ross-is-dead-at-65.html). Please include any “cross-referenced” records relevant to this inquiry. Also please perform a search of “ELSUR” (Electronic Surveillance) records as well.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

John Robichaux

requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

FOIPA request on the FBI’s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBI’s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request tool’ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1491928-000
communications.communication:
To whom it may concern,

I request that I be properly classified as a news media requester. I am a documentary filmmaker who has had films I have authored distributed in over 2000 theaters by Warner Brothers, and I am requesting this information in that editorial capacity.

I have also been employed as a writer by NBC Universal which can be seen on the following iMDB link:

https://www.imdb.com/name/nm2448917/

In addition, I have covered areas related to this request on the live streaming morning news program JackAM (twitch.tv/jackam) which has received of 300,000 viewing hours on the streaming platform Twitch. I plan to use my editorial skills to analyze and produce original reporting work in the form of a documentary film.

If you have any questions about my media status, please contact me.

Thank you very much for your time and understanding,

John Vance Robichaux

title: Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972 FOIA Logs (Department of Justice, Office of the Attorney General)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972 FOIA Logs (Department of Justice, Office of the Attorney General)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of the log of all Freedom of Information Act request made between 2019 and 2025 that includes the term "Title IX" within reference to the Education Amendments of 1972, specifically as they refer to sexual misconduct policy. I ask that all fields — including the subject of the request, the nature and description of the request, the requester, the status of the request, the dates on which it was requested and the date of its most recent status, the tracking number assigned to the request, and the final disposition of the request — be included.

I require this data for academic research purposes, in association with the University of Maryland - College Park. The study aims to understand the recent history of the development of Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972, from 2010 to now.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sarah Silberman

title: Library Contract Request: ProQuest Ebook Central at Prairie View A&M University

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Library Contract Request: ProQuest Ebook Central at Prairie View A&M University
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) The most recent contract, governing, base, or master license agreement with ProQuest (Clarivate) relating to the licensing of Ebook Central;

2) All related terms and conditions, terms of service, amendments, addenda, appendices, attachments, product terms, MOUs, MOAs, data processing agreements, and/or letters of intent; and

3) All financial documents or records of financial transactions, exchanges or obligations related to the contractual relations with ProQuest (Clarivate) for Ebook Central licensing. 

Responsive materials include all contracts, agreements, amendments, appendices, invoices, and any other documents listed above that incorporate language governing terms of use of Ebook Central.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ellen Dubinsky

title: Flock Safety search audits, network sharing, and general order (Tukwila Police Department)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Flock Safety search audits, network sharing, and general order (Tukwila Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records related to the department’s Flock Safety system:
1. Organization Audit in Flock. 
The report should include data logged from the period of December 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of December 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

3. A list of network share settings that include:
3a. Flock networks shared with me
3b. Networks that I’m sharing

Please provide records in their original electronic, machine readable format. For example, please provide csv or spreadsheet files where applicable. Please do not redirect me to your transparency portal.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of May 15, 2025., Reference # P032248-051525. 
Dear Rose  Terse, 
The Tukwila Police Department received a public records request from you on May 15, 2025 via our electronic Records Center. Your request mentioned: "To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

Records related to the department’s Flock Safety system: 
1. Organization Audit in Flock. 
The report should include data logged from the period of December 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency. 

2. Network Audit in Flock. 
The report should include data logged from the period of December 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System. 

3. A list of network share settings that include: 
3a. Flock networks shared with me 
3b. Networks that I’m sharing 

Please provide records in their original electronic, machine readable format. For example, please provide csv or spreadsheet files where applicable. Please do not redirect me to your transparency portal. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Rose Terse 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Ftukwila-police-department-5736%252Fflock-safety-search-audits-network-sharing-and-general-order-tukwila-police-department-186568%252F%253Femail%253Dpdrecords%252540tukwilawa.gov&url_auth_token=AABB8Pcwq_lGbpRlok39-nzQwLA%3A1uFlee%3Ap3Q6N1cCvvBYPSIBQDfLZh8P__wdg2mHIT2gha-uOzM" 
The department has reviewed your request and has determined that some or all of the records requested are exempt from disclosure under the Public Records Act for the following reasons: 
06a Investigative, Law enforcement, crime victims RCW 42.56.240(1) Specific intelligence information and investigative records are exemption from disclosure. 

Please note there are black boxes (redactions) on various pages of the responsive documents. The black box may be small or large, depending on the size of the redaction. There may be multiple redactions on a page. Within the redaction is a white code, which will look something along the lines of “Redacted Text [1a].” This code designates the statutory exemption being applied to the document. If there is only one code on the page, but there are numerous redactions, that one statutory exemption applies to all the redactions. 
Provided with these responsive documents is a key to the codes. This key identifies the statutory bases for the exemption as well as a brief explanation for why the exemption applies. As you review these responsive documents, you will be able to refer to the key below to identify the exemption and its application. 
You should now be able to retrieve any responsive records via the Tukwila PD electronic Record Center. 
Please Note: The network audits are not used or created by the Tukwila Police Department and are not a department records.  Therefore, they will not be provided. 
The records are best viewed on a desktop or laptop computer. The records may not be accessible from a mobile device. The Police Department has provided you with a web link to all records that are responsive to your request.  The Police Department now considers your request as closed, and, therefore does not intend to further address the request.  Any actions to seek judicial review of the City’s response to your request must be filed within one year of this notice in accordance with RCW 42.56.550. 
If you believe that additional responsive records have not been provided or if have any questions, you may contact our office at (206) 433-1808 or email the Police Department through your GovQA account within 30 days of this message. 
Regards, 
Rebecca 
Tukwila Police Department 
206-433-1808

communications.subject: City of Seattle Public Records Request Center - Invoice Ready :: C231564-070625
communications.communication:
Dear Rose Terse, 
 
Records in response to your public disclosure request C231564-070625 received on July 06, 2025 are now available. The cost for the records is as follows: 
 
Invoice Number: INV25-C231564-1 
Total: $1.25 
 
To pay online, please follow these steps: 
 Please note that you will need to disable any pop-up blockers to make a payment using the system. 
 
  * Navigate to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * Select 'My Records Request Center'. 
  * Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login. 
  * Find this request: C231564-070625. 
  * Select the 'View Invoices' button. 
 
  * Opens a pop-up window showing your invoice: INV25-C231564-1. 
  * Click on the invoice and then the 'Pay Now' button. 
  * Continue processing your payment. 
  * Select 'Done'. 
  * Once the payment process is done, you are returned to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * After your payment is successful you will receive an email from our payments center. 
Once your payment has been approved, we will send you an email with instructions on how to download your records. Note that City staff must manually upload records. Records will be available one to two business days after payment. 
 
Please let your public disclosure officer (PDO) know if you are unable to pay online; your PDO will work with you on alternative ways to make your payment. 
 
You have 30 days from today's date to pay for your records. If the City does not receive your payment within this time period, your request will be considered abandoned, and you will need to submit a new request. 
 Please add seattle@mycusthelp.net to your E-mail contacts/address book to ensure delivery of the record center E-mails to your Inbox. (mailto:seattle@mycusthelp.net) 
This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Richard Bast
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents on, about, mentioning, or concerning the private investigator Richard Lee Bast (October 18, 1932 - March 21, 2001), Social Security No. 578-40-9899 and the companies he founded in the greater Washington, DC area known as Redex Corporation (1970s) and International Investigations, Inc. (1980-90s). 

I understand that the file may be rather large. If it exceeds 5,000 pages, I wish to speak to a negotiator to help reduce the scope of responsive records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Best

communications.subject: FOIA request 1411473(Redex Corp)
communications.communication:
Good morning Ms. Best,

We're contacting you about the FOIA request you made for records concerning Redex Corp. The FBI has located approximately 2948 pages that are potentially responsive to your request. Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system, and the FBI receives a voluminous amount of requests on a daily, weekly, monthly, and annual basis.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium (51-950 pages), large (951-8000 pages), and extra-large (over 8000 pages) sub-tracks based upon request size. 

Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  The more potentially responsive pages a request has, the more complex it becomes, greatly increasing the time required for processing.  Generally, the larger the file, the longer it takes to process. A review of your request determined that it is currently in the complex request large processing track.  Given our current workload and staffing levels, it may yet be a long time before you begin to receive material from this request.   

Reducing the scope of your request may accelerate the processing and allow for a more timely receipt of the information you seek, as it could potentially place your request into a smaller, faster processing track.  This may also reduce duplication costs, if applicable.  Would you be willing to consider reducing the scope of your request?  If so, I would be happy to help you to decide the best approach to take.  We could potentially narrow your request by date, or if you are looking for something specific, we could approach the scope reduction process in that way.

Please let us know if you would like to potentially reduce the scope of your request.  We can be reached via email at fbi.foipa.negotiation@fbi.gov, or you may call 540-868-1695, Monday - Friday between the hours of 7:00am and 3:00pm Eastern time.

Best regards,

FOIA Negotiation Team
FBI Information Management Division
540-868-1695

Need a status check? Contact FOIPA Questions (foipaquestions@fbi.gov).

communications.communication:
Good Afternoon Ms. Best,

We're contacting you about the FOIA request you made for records concerning Richard Bast.  The FBI located approximately 3,144 pages that are potentially responsive to your request.  Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system, and the FBI receives a voluminous amount of requests on a daily, weekly, monthly, and annual basis.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium (51-950 pages), large (951-8000 pages), and extra-large (over 8000 pages) sub-tracks based upon request size. 

Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  The more potentially responsive pages a request has, the more complex it becomes, greatly increasing the time required for processing.  Generally, the larger the file, the longer it takes to process.  A review of your request determined that it is currently in the complex request large processing track.  Given our current workload and staffing levels, it may yet be a long time before you begin to receive material from this request.   

Reducing the scope of your request may accelerate the processing and allow for a more timely receipt of the information you seek, as it could potentially place your request into a smaller, faster processing track.  This may also reduce duplication costs, if applicable.  Would you be willing to consider reducing the scope of your request?  If so, we would be happy to help you to decide the best approach to take.  If you are looking for something specific, we could approach the scope reduction process in that way.

The current average time to complete a large track request is approximately 56 months. 

Please let us know if you would like to potentially reduce the scope of your request.  If you reduce the size, you can request the additional records with a new FOIA request upon completion of this one. 

We can be reached via email at fbi.foipa.negotiation@fbi.gov, or you may call 540-868-4894.  We appreciate your patience and hope to hear from you soon.

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All communications that include the term "Gulf of America" or "renaming the Gulf of Mexico".

This should include–but not be limited to—emails, notes, memoranda and presentations between USGS staff and between USGS staff and external third parties.

Please include all documentation within the period January 1, 2024 to January 22, 2025, inclusive.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matt Reynolds

Dear Matt Reynolds, 
We would like to inform you that the Department of the Interior has received your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request and assigned it the control number DOI-2025-003235. Please reference this number in any future communications regarding your request. 
To Whom It May Concern:Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:All communications that include the term "Gulf of America" or "renaming the Gulf of Mexico".This should include–but not be limited to—emails, notes, memoranda and presentations between USGS staff and between USGS staff and external third parties.Please include all documentation within the period January 1, 2024 to January 22, 2025, inclusive.The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.Sincerely,Matt ReynoldsUpload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fus-geological-survey-6097%252Fusgs-communications-180259%252F%253Femail%253Dfoia%252540usgs.gov&url_auth_token=AAAephS6mi_p4D79Y3O7eDD0Uis%3A1tbAfn%3ANY7Jj_OfMbn-GGkGUZD25X0h4Vg4jgetcCwZ0oMSa_4 

This message has been sent from an unattended email inbox. For any further correspondence, please contact the bureau at https://www.doi.gov/foia/contacts. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter.
Regards, 
DOI FOIA Office

communications.subject: FOIA: DOI-2025-003235 – Acknowledgment of your FOIA Request
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Reynolds:

On January 24, 2025, the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) FOIA office received your FOIA request and assigned it control number DOI-2025-03235.  Please cite this number in any future communications with our office regarding your request.  You request the following information:

All communications that include the term "Gulf of America" or "renaming the Gulf of Mexico".

This should include–but not be limited to—emails, notes, memoranda and presentations between USGS staff and between USGS staff and external third parties.

Please include all documentation within the period January 1, 2024 to January 22, 2025, inclusive.

On January 21, 2025, the USGS FOIA office received a similar FOIA request from Mr. Dave Levinthal, assigned control number DOI-2025-003169, for the following information:

Request disclosure from the Office of the Director, Office of Communications and Publishing, U.S. Board on Geographic Names, Office of the Alaska Regional Director, and Office of the Southeast Regional Director.

1. Any records and documents — including but not limited to emails, memoranda, notes, electronic chat messages and calendar items — that include any of the following words/names in either uppercase or lowercase form on changing the name:

• Gulf of Mexico to Gulf of America
• Denali to Mt. McKinley or Mount McKinley

2. The same types of records on purchase of Greenland

The date range for this request is January 1, 2025, to the present.

On January 21, 2025, the USGS FOIA office received a similar FOIA request from Bloomberg News, assigned control number DOI-2025-003184, for the following information:

Request disclosure from the US Geological Survey's U.S. Board on Geographic Names

1) All records, which includes, but is not limited to emails (including attachments), text messages, internal studies, final reports, directives, memos, letters, on changing the name of the Gulf of Mexico the "Gulf of America."

2)The same types of records on changing the name of Denali to "Mount McKinley."

3) Emails (including attachments) of U.S. Board on Geographic Names staff that mention "Gulf of America"

4) Emails of U.S. Board on Geographic Names staff that mention Denali or Mount McKinley.

The timeframe for this request is January 1, 2025 to the present.

Additionally, on January 22, 2025, the USGS FOIA office received a similar FOIA request from WIRED, assigned control number DOI-2025-003203, for the following information:

Records dated from December 1, 2024 through the time this request is processed relating to Donald Trump's desire to rename the Gulf of Mexico as the Gulf of America and the related executive order and in the possession of Michael Tischler, Shellie Zahniser, or Chris Hammond of the U.S. Geological Survey.  The term “records” includes emails (with attachments) but also refers to other documents and items, such as text messages; invitations, communications, and chats from meeting applications such as Zoom and Microsoft Teams; encrypted apps such as Signal, WhatsApp, and others; phone records; calendar entries; recordings of virtual or in-person meetings; and communications on collaboration platforms such as Slack. It omits news articles and messages from listservs that distribute them unless accompanied by substantial commentary from one of the above-named people or an interlocutor.

Your request falls into the Complex processing track.  We have gathered materials as potentially responsive to DOI-2025-003169, DOI-2025-003184, and DOI-2025-003203.  However, we have not yet completed a review of these records.  We will provide records in rolling releases to you in conjunction with releases issue for DOI-2025-003169, DOI-2025-003184, and DOI-2025-003203.

We classified you as an “other use” requester.  As such, we may charge you for some of our search and duplication costs, but we will not charge you for our review costs; you are also entitled to up to 2 hours of search time and 100 pages of photocopies (or an equivalent volume) for free.  See 43 C.F.R. § 2.39.  If, after taking into consideration your fee category entitlements, our processing costs are less than $50.00, we will not bill you because the cost of collection would be greater than the fee collected.  See 43 C.F.R. § 2.49(a)(1).  We do not anticipate any fees related to your request.

The 2007 FOIA amendments created the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) to offer mediation services to resolve disputes between FOIA requesters and Federal agencies as a non-exclusive alternative to litigation.  Using OGIS services does not affect your right to pursue litigation.  You may contact OGIS in any of the following ways:

Office of Government Information Services
National Archives and Records Administration
8601 Adelphi Road – OGIS
College Park, Maryland  20740-6001
Telephone:     (202) 741-5770
Fax:                 (202) 741-5769
Toll-free:         1-877-684-6448
E-mail:            ogis@nara.gov<mailto:ogis@nara.gov>
Web:                https://www.archives.gov/ogis

Please note that using OGIS services does not affect the timing of filing an appeal with the Department’s FOIA & Privacy Act Appeals Officer.  Contact information for the Department’s FOIA Public Liaison, who you may also seek dispute resolution services from, is available at https://www.doi.gov/foia/foiacenters.

If you have any questions, please contact me by email at jcearley@usgs.gov<mailto:jcearley@usgs.gov>.




Sincerely,

Judy Cearley

Government Information Specialist

U.S. Geological Survey

Department of the Interior

(650) 329-4035 (office)

foia@usgs.gov<mailto:foia@usgs.gov>

communications.subject: FOIA: DOI-USGS-2025-003235 - Delayed Processing Notification
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Reynolds,

We are writing regarding your FOIA request, DOI-USGS-2025-003235, to provide delayed processing notification.

As yet, we have been unable to make a determination on your request, but we do intend to comply with your request.  Your request falls into the Complex processing track, there are 11 requests pending ahead of yours in our processing queue.

At this time, we are actively working on your request.  We have completed the preliminary review of the potentially responsive records.  We are preparing an interim release to you and have sent the records for an internal review.  We anticipate providing the interim release to you by March 17, 2025.

Due to the nature of the remaining records, consultations have been sent to other federal agencies, and we are waiting for their responses.  Once we receive responses from the other federal agencies, the records will still need to go through legal review by the Department of the Interior, Office of the Solicitor, Division of General Law.

We apologize for this delay.  You may narrow the scope of your request to obtain quicker processing in your currently assigned track or move the request into a different track (which may have the effect of reducing the cost of processing your request and having it processed more quickly).  You also may agree to an alternative time period for processing by communicating with us, our FOIA Requester Center, or the FOIA Public Liaison.  Contact information for the Department’s FOIA Requester Centers and FOIA Public Liaison is available at https://www.doi.gov/foia/foiacenters.

You may also seek dispute resolution services from the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS).  If you choose to contact OGIS, you may do so in any of the following ways:

Office of Government Information Services
National Archives and Records Administration
8601 Adelphi Road – OGIS
College Park, Maryland  20740-6001
Telephone:      (202) 741-5770
Toll-free:         1-877-684-6448
E-mail:            ogis@nara.gov<mailto:ogis@nara.gov>
Web:                https://ogis.archives.gov<https://ogis.archives.gov/>

You may file an appeal with the Department’s FOIA/Privacy Act Appeals Officer regarding this delay.  If you choose to appeal this delay, you may do so anytime between now and the date we make our determination on the FOIA request.  Appeals arriving or delivered after 5 p.m. Eastern Time, Monday through Friday, will be deemed received on the next workday.

Your appeal must be made in writing.  You may submit your appeal and accompanying materials to the FOIA/Privacy Act Appeals Officer by mail, courier service, fax, or email.  All communications concerning your appeal should be clearly marked with the words: "FREEDOM OF INFORMATION APPEAL."  You must also include with your appeal copies of all correspondence between you and USGS concerning your FOIA request, including your original FOIA request and USGS's response.  Failure to include with your appeal all correspondence between you and USGS will result in the Department's rejection of your appeal, unless the FOIA/Privacy Act Appeals Officer determines (in the FOIA/Privacy Act Appeals Officer’s sole discretion) that good cause exists to accept the defective appeal.

Please include your name and daytime telephone number (or the name and telephone number of an appropriate contact), email address and fax number (if available) in case the FOIA/Privacy Act Appeals Officer needs additional information or clarification of your appeal.

DOI FOIA/Privacy Act Appeals Office Contact Information
Department of the Interior
Office of the Solicitor
Attn: FOIA/Privacy Act Appeals Office
1849 C Street, N.W.
MS-6556 MIB
Washington, DC  20240
Telephone:      (202) 208-5339
Fax:                 (202) 208-6677
Email:              FOIA.Appeals@sol.doi.gov<https://mail.google.com/mail/?view=cm&fs=1&tf=1&to=FOIA.Appeals@sol.doi.gov>

For more information on FOIA Administrative Appeals, you may review the Department's FOIA regulations at 43 C.F.R. Part 2, Subpart H<https://www.ecfr.gov/current/title-43/part-2#subpart-H>.<http://www.ecfr.gov/cgi-bin/text-idx?c=ecfr&sid=0fc3ab3499768eebc2e3691c8cf88dec&rgn=div5&view=text&node=43:1.1.1.1.2&idno=43#43:1.1.1.1.2.8>

We regret the delay and appreciate your consideration.  If you have any questions, please contact me by email at foia@usgs.gov<mailto:foia@usgs.gov>.

Thank you for your patience while we continue processing your request.




Sincerely,

Judy Cearley

Government Information Specialist

U.S. Geological Survey

Department of the Interior

(650) 329-4035 (office)

foia@usgs.gov<mailto:foia@usgs.gov>

title: Academic Dishonesty Study (Texas A&m Kingsville University)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Academic Dishonesty Study (Texas A&m Kingsville University)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I would like a spreadsheet containing all the academic dishonesty reports from the beginning of the Fall 2021 semester to the end of the Spring 2025 Semester, organized by university college.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Anonymous

title: Request for Correctional Mental Health Staff Directory and Contact Information (D.C. Department of Corrections)

communications.subject: DC Freedom of Information Act Request: Request for Correctional Mental Health Staff Directory and Contact Information (D.C. Department of Corrections)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the DC Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting a list of currently employed mental health professionals within your state's Department of Corrections or its subsidiary agencies, as well as their contact information.

Specifically, I am requesting:

- Full names
- Job titles
- Assigned correctional facility
- Government-issued email addresses
- Government-issued phone numbers (direct desk numbers if available, otherwise department phone numbers with or without extensions)
- Department/division (e.g. Behavioral Health, Mental Health Services)

This request applies to the following roles: rehabilitative program coordinators, licensed psychologists, psychiatrists, clinical social workers, and other licensed mental health professionals serving incarcerated populations in state-operated facilities.

If available, I request this information be provided in a machine-readable format such as CSV or Excel.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Ma

communications.communication:
Dear MuckRock News: 
Thank you for your interest in public records of District of Columbia. Your request has been received and is being processed. Your request was received in this office on 6/11/2025 and given the reference number R011574-061125 for tracking purposes. 
In all future correspondence regarding this request, please reference request number R011574-061125. You can monitor the progress of your request in the " My Records Center". (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.VEsWrlMiJDg0mXafq1mEXcOhwwBPGHifqhO6OQOqgdwS-2FNpGxLbyeC-2FXmT4cIxy2lH6u_B-2FefHXMqqa3-2BMeO3armGlK19P1MtxST266YUwqBM8MOm-2FXhmDarTSxE4Is9KhDiwE40eBzdhG2MLN-2Bk-2B8iL7Q44Tm7XKhivihC6EX6MMTNS5cupEyvS5S8uYBWzMuBCNVAJXg-2Fl-2B0QHK8S3WtJXIXd65z3J9gHcjR1jM7NdMGdkhvMJYSq2bzdrTaCPkS2qCWUStx-2BV1Z4RSQol4XF5UAIcacGnwFAe5fxkLtBwFLnUS38nQXf-2Bm315r5V0s0Cfo7F-2FTwbo9omtbi8pSAvAVVyZOkf2MW74BnmMnglvDjxCve4NDTg6Vo-2BX0kVZ1HB1piQmlQwMUCNv1GWpT7VF-2BTQ0nfDG0JJOkeZ99qrQygMeUYQa6WJnYGaDH81bUODDJ) 
 
The District of Columbia is required to respond to your FOIA request within fifteen (15) business days of its receipt.  See D.C. Official Code § 2-532(c)(2011).  However, under certain circumstances, D.C. Official Code § 2-532(d)(2011) authorizes the District to extend, by ten (10) additional days, the deadline by which it must respond to a FOIA request.  One of the circumstances provided by that statute is a case in which the District needs additional time to search for, collect and examine voluminous amounts of records and/or consult with an additional D.C. agency. 
For any questions regarding your request, please contact the FOIA office directly. Find the list of agency Open Government and FOIA contact information by visiting FOIA Contact Information. For ease of reference, we ask that you have your FOIA Reference Number available when you contact the FOIA office. 
Regards, 
District of Columbia 
To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the DC FOIA Center (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.VEsWrlMiJDg0mXafq1mEXcOhwwBPGHifqhO6OQOqgdxw4Mq-2FzcQk7O8GiIWvvoHaFe7dwUbT3XILFbXayco3OHANGC-2BQPP9LKzK-2FS0mkS98-3DfwTD_B-2FefHXMqqa3-2BMeO3armGlK19P1MtxST266YUwqBM8MOm-2FXhmDarTSxE4Is9KhDiwE40eBzdhG2MLN-2Bk-2B8iL7Q44Tm7XKhivihC6EX6MMTNS5cupEyvS5S8uYBWzMuBCNVAJXg-2Fl-2B0QHK8S3WtJXIXd65z3J9gHcjR1jM7NdMGdkhvMJYSq2bzdrTaCPkS2qCWUStx-2BV1Z4RSQol4XF5UAIcacGnwFAe5fxkLtBwFLnUS38nQXf-2Bm315r5V0s0CfoPcSk1WMzFuVxZy3JlZY7uv-2BtMKExqWJ-2FCEK1Hz0c4-2FQN-2FJbDhplHp7o-2Fa7jgoVQRDX51aypZyQdSgmHFHRSmMPntFU5dtMzADZY5iSv61igEk1sODXC21QmWWhHLX-2BVS)

communications.subject: RE: DC Freedom of Information Act Request: Request for Correctional Mental Health Staff Directory and Contact Information (D.C. Department of Corrections)
communications.communication:
Andrew Ma
MuckRock News
DEPT MR 186573
263 Huntington Ave
Boston, MA 02115

Dear Mr. Ma,

This is the response of the DC Department of Corrections (DOC) to your below FOIA request, seeking “a list of currently employed mental health professionals” serving the inmates that are in DOC’s custody. Please be advised that a contractor, Unity Health Care, Inc., provides health care services to DOC inmates. The information you are requesting relates to the contractor’s personnel matter. It is not the kind of information that DOC creates and maintains. Under the FOIA, an agency’s search obligation is limited to records or information the agency has created and/or maintained. Finally, DOC did not create and did not find the requested list.

If you consider this response a denial of your FOIA request, please be advised that, under D.C. Official Code § 2-537 and 1 DCMR 412, you may appeal to the Mayor or to the Superior Court of the District of Columbia.

If you elect to appeal to the Mayor, your appeal must be in writing and contain “Freedom of Information Act Appeal” or “FOIA Appeal” in the subject line of the letter as well as on the outside of the envelope.  The appeal must include (1) a copy of the original request, (2) a copy of this letter, (3) a statement of the circumstances, reasons, and or arguments advanced in support of disclosure, and (4) a daytime telephone number, and e-mail and/or U.S. Mail address at which you can be reached.  The appeal must be emailed to foia.appeals@dc.gov<mailto:foia.appeals@dc.gov> or mailed to the Mayor’s Office of Legal Counsel (MOLC) at 1350 Pennsylvania Avenue, N.W., Suite 407, Washington, D.C. 20004. Further, a copy of all appeal materials must be forwarded to me.

Failure to follow these administrative steps will result in delay in the processing and commencement of a response to your appeal to the Mayor.

Sincerely,

Oluwasegun Obebe
Records, Information & Privacy Officer
DC Department of Corrections
Office of the General Counsel
3924 Minnesota Ave, NE
Washington, DC 20019
(202) 671-2055 (O)
(202) 538-2389 (C)

communications.subject: RE: DC Freedom of Information Act Request: Request for Correctional Mental Health Staff Directory and Contact Information (D.C. Department of Corrections)
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Obebe,

Thank you again for your response and for clarifying that mental health services are provided by Unity Health Care.

In light of that, I’d like to respectfully follow up with two related requests:
	1.	Chaplaincy Contacts: Could the DC Department of Corrections provide a list of currently employed or contracted chaplains or staff involved in spiritual or faith-based programming within DOC-operated facilities? Specifically, I’m looking for:
	•	Full names
	•	Job titles
	•	Assigned facility
	•	Government-issued work email (or phone number if email is not available)
	2.	Unity Health Care Liaison: I understand that DOC does not maintain personnel records for Unity Health Care. That said, would it be possible to share contact information for a point of contact at Unity Health Care — ideally someone in a supervisory or coordination role — who oversees behavioral or mental health programming in DOC facilities? If you do not have this directly on file, any guidance or direction would be appreciated.

To provide some context: I represent a grassroots meditation group that offers free, trauma-informed mindfulness programs to support the well-being of incarcerated individuals. We’re hoping to connect with relevant stakeholders — including chaplains and behavioral health coordinators — to understand whether our offerings might be supportive within existing wellness or rehabilitative programming.

Thank you again for your time and consideration.

Warm regards,
Andrew Ma

title: Flock Safety search audits, network sharing, and general order (Bonney Lake Police Department)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Flock Safety search audits, network sharing, and general order (Bonney Lake Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records related to the department’s Flock Safety system:
1. Organization Audit in Flock. 
The report should include data logged from the period of December 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of December 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

3. A list of network share settings that include:
3a. Flock networks shared with me
3b. Networks that I’m sharing

Please provide records in their original electronic, machine readable format. For example, please provide csv or spreadsheet files where applicable. Please do not redirect me to your transparency portal.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: Public Records Request
communications.communication:
Good morning,

Request number: 20250612-RT1

We received your request for FLOCK records. We have located responsive records for items 1, 3a and 3b. The scope of records for item 2 would be very large and creating a record that we do not have. Pursuant to per WAC 44-14-04003(6)<https://app.leg.wa.gov/wac/default.aspx?cite=44-14-04003>, we are not obligated to create a record in order to fulfill this request:

(6) No duty to create records. An agency is not obligated to create a new record to satisfy a records request. However, sometimes it is easier for an agency to create a record responsive to the request rather than collecting and making available voluminous records that contain small pieces of the information sought by the requestor or find itself in a controversy about whether the request requires the creation of a new record. The decision to create a new record is left to the discretion of the agency. With respect to databases, for example, there is not always a simple dichotomy between producing an existing record and creating a new record. In addition, an agency may decide to provide a customized service and if so, assess a customized service charge for the actual costs of staff technology expertise needed to prepare data compilations, or when such customized access services are not used by the agency for other business purposes.

However, if you wish to receive the records responsive to items 1, 3a and 3b there is a fee of $3.50. I have attached the worksheet for how the fee was calculated based off the fact that necessary redactions will be applied to some documents. Please call the main line below during normal business hours Mon-Fri 8:30-4:30) to pay your fee. We will be closed tomorrow, 6/19.

If we do not receive payment by 6/27/25 your request will be considered abandoned and closed.

Thank you,

[cid:image002.png@01DBE033.AC1569C0]
Miranda Jeter
Records Clerk
Bonney Lake Police Department
Office Phone (253) 863 - 2218 opt. 4
Fax  (253) 863 - 2661
18421 Veterans Memorial Drive E. Bonney Lake, WA 98391

communications.subject: Public Records Act Response – Closing Letter
communications.communication:
Dear Rose Terse,

Request number: 20250612-RT1

This letter is to inform you I have enclosed all records in response to your public records request which you made on 6/12/25 for a copy of “Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:
Records related to the department's Flock Safety system:
1. Organization Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of Decemebr 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the ageny.
2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should inlude data logged from the period of December 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is avialble within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization's Flock network by any agency in the Flock system.
3. A list of network share settings that include:
3a. Flock networks shared with me
3b. Networks that I'm sharing
Please provide records in their original electronic, machine readable format. For example, please provide csv or spreadsheet files where applicable. Please do not redirect me to your transparency portal.
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.”

Please note that some records have either been withheld in their entirety or redacted based on a statutory exemption. For any records that may be denied, you do have the right to seek internal review of any denials of requests per RCW 42.56.520(4).<https://app.leg.wa.gov/RCW/default.aspx?cite=42.56.520> The enclosed exemption log provides information about the records withheld and/or redacted and the basis for withholding or redaction.

Your records request is considered fulfilled and, therefore, is now closed. The one-year statute of limitations to seek judicial review has started.

This concludes the City of Bonney Lake’s response to your public disclosure request; your request is now closed. If you believe that the City of Bonney Lake has other records that are responsive to this request, or if you have questions or difficulty viewing the records provided, please contact me within 14 days.

Please contact the office at (253) 863-2218 opt 4, fax (253) 863-2661 or by email pdrecords@cobl.us<mailto:pdrecords@cobl.us> if you need further assistance.

Thank you,

[cid:image006.png@01DBF57A.63913EC0]
Miranda Jeter
Records Clerk
Bonney Lake Police Department
Office Phone (253) 863 – 2218 opt. 4
Fax (253) 863 - 2661
18421 Veterans Memorial Drive E. Bonney Lake, WA 98391

title: Library Contract Request: EBSCO Education Research (Delaware Technical Community College)

communications.subject: Delaware Freedom of Information Act Request: Library Contract Request: EBSCO Education Research (Delaware Technical Community College)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Delaware Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The most recent contract, governing, base, or master license agreement with EBSCO relating to the licensing of Education Research;
All related terms and conditions, terms of service, amendments, addenda, appendices, attachments, product terms, MOUs, MOAs, data processing agreements, and/or letters of intent; and
All financial documents or records of financial transactions, exchanges or obligations related to the contractual relations with EBSCO for Education Research database licensing. 

Responsive materials include all contracts, agreements, amendments, appendices, invoices, and any other documents listed above that incorporate language governing terms of use of Education Research.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jonathan Rudenberg, a citizen of Delaware, in coordination with smhc.

communications.subject: Re: [External]   Delaware Freedom of Information Act Request: Library Contract Request: EBSCO Education Research (Delaware Technical Community College)
communications.communication:
Hello, Jonathan Rudenberg:

This email confirms receipt of your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request made to Delaware Technical Community College on July 7, 2025.

Please find the requested documents attached along with an explanation provided below.


Delaware Technical Community College's total paid amount to EBSCO in FY25 was $130,030.20. This includes the Education Research Complete product, and the related/specific Ed Research product order (see Attachment 1), as well as purchases of various Campus periodical orders under the Standard License Agreement (see Attachment 2). The purchase order activity is summarized below.

Delaware Tech Fiscal Year 2025 purchase orders obligating for the actual payments (via State FSF voucher and/or State PCard) are summarized in attachment 3.



State of DE-DTCC Vendor/eSupplier specific obligation and payment info during FY25:


EBSCO INDUSTRIES INC

EBSCO INFORMATION SERVICES
P O BOX 204661
DALLAS TX 75320


  *
OOP CCIT Product Order totaling $71,858.00 per PO701423 dated 7/17/24. The annual order form and continued agreement/support as attached confirm the 2024 terms are unchanged since the 2022 version.
     *   $34,380.00 Academic Search Complete and various 7/1/24-6/30/25
     *   $22,285.00 CINAHL Complete and various 9/1/24-8/31/25
     *   $15,193.00 Education Research Complete 10/1/24-9/30/25

Please feel free to reach out if you have any questions. This officially concludes the FOIA process for this request.

Thank you,
Amanda
